label: AB_tI4_139_a_b-002
title: ``Martensite Type'' FeC$_{x}$ ($x < 0.06$) ($L'2_{0}$) Structure
comments:
This should {\em not} be considered a true model of martensite, a very complex material whose structure is sensitive to composition (Blackwell, 1996; Sherby, 2008).  However, (Ewald, 1931) assign this the label $L'2_{0}$, saying that this structure is ``$\alpha$-Fe with 6 atomic percent C.'' Although (Ewald, 1931) present a long discussion of martensite (pp. 489, 576-583), they do not give this exact crystal structure, which we take from (Brandes, 1992) and (Pearson, 1967). 
 (Villars, 1995) and (Westbrook, 1995) ignore this structure and give the $L'2$ label to \href{current_web_home_dir/A2B_tI6_139_d_a-001}{the ThH$_{2}$ structure}.  We previously followed this notation, but in the interest of historical accuracy will relabel that structure with the name given to it by (Brandes, 1992) and (Pearson, 1967), $L'2_{b}$. 
 We should note that these last two references list the current structure simply as $L'2$. 
 \href{current_web_home_dir/AB_tI4_139_a_b-002}{$L'2_{0}$ FeC$_{x}$} and \href{current_web_home_dir/AB_tI4_139_a_b-003}{$\beta$-LiFeO$_{2}$} have the same AFLOW prototype label, AB\_tI4\_139\_a\_b. They are generated by the same symmetry operations with different sets of parameters ({\tt --params}) specified in their corresponding CIF files.
